title.narrative: Essential GBV response services to women and girls living with disabilities in IDP sites and host communities in Cabo Delgado

description.narrative: This UNFPA project aims to provide essential GBV response services to women and girls living with disabilities in IDP sites and host communities in Cabo Delgado.UNFPA, with its implementing partners, will implement life-saving Sexual and gender-based violence (SGBV) prevention and response services targeting women and girls with disabilities in Ancuabe, Metuge, and Montepuez districts of Cabo Delgado by:(i) Establish an inclusive call center for reporting of S/GBV for women and young persons with disabilities, including training of call center staff; (ii)Developing a disability-specific referral pathway for women and girls with disabilities; (iii)Provide S/GBV case management and referral services for women and girls with disabilities; and (iv) Conduct GBV awareness-raising sessions for persons with disabilities at the community level, thereby ensuring proper engagement and support for women and girls with disabilities as well as awareness about reporting mechanisms. In total, 5,326 persons will be targeted, including 2,069 women, 688 men, and 2569 children with disabilities.
